explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions the application of machine learning to predict asset returns and improve portfolio selection models.
explanations.supervised learning: The methods used (Support Vector Regression, Elastic-Net, eXtreme Gradient Boosting) are supervised learning techniques as they involve training on labeled data (asset returns).
explanations.regression: Support Vector Regression is a regression technique used in the paper to forecast asset returns.
explanations.support vector machine: Support Vector Regression (SVR) is a variant of SVM used for regression tasks, mentioned in the paper.
explanations.SVM: Support Vector Regression (SVR) is based on SVM, hence SVM is relevant.
explanations.decision tree: eXtreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost) is an ensemble method that uses decision trees as base learners, hence decision trees are relevant.
